revised_title: Variational Principle for Discontinuous Trial Functions in Atomic and Molecular Structure Problems
tldr: The authors develop a new variational principle that allows the use of discontinuous trial functions in atomic and molecular structure problems. They apply this principle to one-body, molecular, and two-electron atomic systems, demonstrating its effectiveness in calculating wavefunctions and eigenvalues. This approach provides a more flexible and accurate method for solving these types of problems.
